COMMAND.name: show interface
show NeighbourSuppressStatus
COMMAND.help: Show arp and nd suppression status

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command is used to show information about threshold breach events recorded by the system.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to display the threshold breach events recorded by the system.

PARAM.name: headroom
PARAM.help: choose headroom as threshold buffer type

PARAM.name: shared
PARAM.help: choose shared as threshold buffer type

PARAM.name: queue_buffer_type
PARAM.help: choose from unicast/multicast as queue buffer type

PARAM.name: eventid-switch
PARAM.help: breach clear type all or eventId

PARAM.name: eventId
PARAM.help: Clear threshold breach of an eventId

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command is used to clear all or a given threshold breach event(s) recorded by the system.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear all or a given threshold breach event(s) recorded by the system.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli# clear threshold breach all sonic-cli# clear threshold breach eventId

COMMAND.name: interface PortChannel
COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_if portchannel_config PortChannel${lag-id} mode=${PoMode} min-links=${min-links-value} fallback=${fallback}

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: this command is to configure buffer pool threshold on ingress/egress buffers pools-lossy/lossless.
DOCGEN.USAGE: use this command to configure buffer pool threshold on ingress/egress buffer pools-lossy/lossless.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# buffer-pool threshold ingress_lossless_pool 1 sonic(config)# buffer-pool threshold egress_lossy_pool 1 sonic(config)# buffer-pool threshold egress_lossless_pool 1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command can be used to remove buffer-pool threshold configured on ingress and egress buffers.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to remove buffer-pool threshold configured on ingress and egress buffers.

EXAMPLE.summary: Removes previously configured buffer-pool threshold on ingress and egress buffers.

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: no nat-zone
COMMAND.help: Remove Nat Zone on an interface

COMMAND.name: switchport access
COMMAND.help: Set access mode characteristics of the interface

PARAM.name: Vlan
PARAM.help: Set VLAN when interface is in access mode

PARAM.name: vlan-id
PARAM.help: VLAN ID of the VLAN when this port is in access mode

COMMAND.name: switchport trunk
COMMAND.help: Configure trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: allowed
PARAM.help: Configure trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: Vlan
PARAM.help: Configure trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: vlan_id_list
PARAM.help: (-) or (,) separated individual VLAN IDs and ranges of VLAN IDs; for example, 20,70-100,142

COMMAND.name: no switchport access
COMMAND.help: Remove access mode characteristics of the interface

PARAM.name: Vlan
PARAM.help: Remove VLAN when interface is in access mode

COMMAND.name: no switchport trunk
COMMAND.help: Remove trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: allowed
PARAM.help: Remove trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: Vlan
PARAM.help: Remove trunking parameters on an interface

PARAM.name: vlan_id_list
PARAM.help: (-) or (,) separated individual VLAN IDs and ranges of VLAN IDs; for example, 20,70-100,142

COMMAND.name: threshold
COMMAND.help: Configure priority-group/queue threshold on an interface.

PARAM.name: headroom
PARAM.help: choose headroom as threshold buffer type

PARAM.name: shared
PARAM.help: choose shared as threshold buffer type

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command is used to configure a threshold for a specific priority-group shared/headroom buffer of an interface. The threshold value is provided in %. Valid values are 1-100.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure a threshold for a specific priority-group shared/headroom buffer of an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# threshold priority-group 5 headroom 57 sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# threshold priority-group 7 shared 78

PARAM.name: queue_buffer_type
PARAM.help: choose from unicast/multicast as queue buffer type

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command is used to configure a threshold for a specific unicast/multicast queue of an interface. The threshold value is provided in %. Valid values are 1-100..
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure queue threshold for a specific unicast/multicast queue of an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# threshold queue 4 unicast 47 sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# threshold queue 2 multicast 67

PARAM.name: headroom
PARAM.help: Choose headroom as threshold buffer type.

PARAM.name: shared
PARAM.help: Choose shared as threshold buffer type.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command can be used to clear a previously configured threshold on shared/headroom priority-group buffer of an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear a previously configured threshold on shared/headroom priority-group buffer of an interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Clear a previously configured threshold on shared/headroom priority-group buffer of an interface.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no threshold priority-group 5 headroom sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no threshold priority-group 7 shared

PARAM.name: unicast
PARAM.help: Choose unicast as queue buffer type.

PARAM.name: multicast
PARAM.help: Choose multicast as queue buffer type.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command can be used to clear a previously configured threshold on unicast/multicast queue buffer of an interface .
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear a previously configured threshold on unicast/multicast queue buffer of an interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Clear a previously configured threshold on unicast/multicast queue buffer of an interface.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no threshold queue 7 unicast sonic(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no threshold queue 5 multicast

COMMAND.help: Remove Nat Zone on the interface

COMMAND.help: Configure separate IP on Vlan interface for L3 protocol support over MCLAG

COMMAND.name: no mclag-separate-ip
COMMAND.help: Unconfigure separate IP on Vlan interface for L3 protocol support over MCLAG

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Vlan 10 sonic-cli(conf-if-Vlan10)# no mclag-separate-ip

COMMAND.name: threshold queue
COMMAND.help: Configure queue buffer threshold on CPU interface.

PARAM.name: multicast
PARAM.help: choose multicast as queue buffer type on CPU interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command is used to configure multicact queue buffer threshold of CPU interface. The threshold value is provided in %. Valid values are 1-100..
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure multicast queue buffer threshold of CPU interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure queue buffer threshold of CPU interface.

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: no threshold queue
COMMAND.help: Clears CPU interface queue buffer threshold.

PARAM.name: multicast
PARAM.help: Choose multicast as queue buffer type.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command can be used to clear a previously configured threshold on multicast queue buffer of CPU interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear a previously configured threshold on multicast queue buffer of CPU interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Clears previously configured threshold on multicast queue buffer of CPU interface.
